snippet: The cost of credits for renewable fuels is soaring, hurting the profits and share prices of independent refiners that do not add biofuels to their products....
abstract: Small independent oil-refiners complain federal program that requires them to buy renewable fuel credits coupled with low-cost of gasoline caused by fuel glut is eating profits and could lead to bankruptcies and consolidation; suggest market speculators may be driving up cost of credits, which are administered by Environmental Protection Agency.
lead_paragraph: The cost of credits for renewable fuels is soaring, hurting the profits and share prices of independent refiners that do not add biofuels to their products.

headline.main: High-Price Ethanol Credits Add to Refiners’ Woes
headline.print_headline: Cost of Credits  for Ethanol Adds to Woes for Refiners
